ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Reading poetry for craft so I can use techniques for my own poems.
attention to rhythm and form, introduction to syllabics, focus on sonics of words
My poetry really changed over the course of this class. I learned valuable editing skills.
I learned a great deal about the craft of poetry and how to be a more discerning reader of poetry.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strength: learned more about how to read poetry
Weakness: student feedback wasnt very helpful; I think more written feedback from Professor Zarin wouldve been very helpful, since office hours were quite illuminating

Getting to workshop with peers every week was the best part of the course; your poetry will really get better and you'll be exposed to so many different writers, especially writers at Yale. The class felt very diverse, which was a strong point. The focus of the class, however, was a bit narrower. Office hours will be tough. Work together with the other students in class and you'll see improvement.

The workshop format was really great - it's wonderful to share your poems in this way - and the class is really built around this. I liked how with this as the main focus, the assignments and conversations were directed to this and not stressful in any way. I think one way it could be improved (which we discussed in class) is the option to give written feedback on the printed sheets of poems.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, because poetry is the world.

Yes, without a doubt, I would recommend this course to another student! You will learn so much from Zarin, but you will also get what you put into the course. The workload is not very high (writing 1 poem a week and selecting a published poem to bring in), so it can be tempting to put this class on the backburner. However, if you put the time and energy in, your work will grow tremendously because of the workshop setting and because of Zarin who is infinitely helpful and insightful in class and in office hours. Zarin begins each class by having us read poems that we brought in, and she sometimes selects a theme or poetic device to focus on. Just being present in that time, you will learn so much. And you will also learn a lot when other students are up for workshop.
Yes absolutely - it's a great way to improve your poetry and also meet other writers + read new poems!
